title: Snap Lays Off 20% of Employees and Restructures
description: The maker of Snapchat discontinued some of its products and appointed a chief operating officer, amid financial struggles.

title: Doug Mastriano’s Extremely Online Rise to Republicans’ Governor Nominee in Pa.
description: The G.O.P. candidate for governor of Pennsylvania deftly used Facebook to build a loyal right-wing fan base at the height of the pandemic. Will it be enough to win a competitive general election?

title: Many Developed Countries View Online Misinformation as ‘Major Threat’
description: New research from the Pew Research Center shows nearly three-quarters of respondents are very concerned about the spread of false information online.

title: Some Carmakers Say Recycling Car Parts Is the Future. But Is It Realistic?
description: “Circular manufacturing” has the promise to reduce waste by reusing parts to make new cars. There are glimmers of hope, but they are currently outweighed by challenges.

title: Google Says Trump’s Truth Social Must Scrub Violent Content to Join Play Store
description: The social media app is not available on Google’s app store, and the former president’s company and Google are publicly disagreeing about why.

title: The Animal Translators
description: Scientists are using machine learning to eavesdrop on naked mole rats, fruit bats, crows and whales — and to communicate back.
